How are +, e+, -, and e+ relevant for 
feature detection?
We want E(u,v) to be large for small shifts in all directions
Thus, the minimum of E(u,v) should be large, this minimum is given by the 
smaller eigenvalue - of M

Feature Detection Algorithm
•Compute the gradient at each point in the image
•Create the M matrix for each point from the gradients in a window 
•Compute the eigenvalues of each M
•Find points with large response (- > threshold)
•Choose those points as features where - is a local maximum
